intro: Paypayrola blanchetiana, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of California and Nevada. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, often at elevations between 2,000 and 8,000 feet. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branched and upright. The species is known for its showy blooms that appear in late spring to early summer.
